com.magnet.async

Interface Call<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The return data type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Future<T>

    public interface Call<T>
extends Future<T>
    This interface represents an asynchronous invocation to a controller. An instance of the Call is typically returned by a method call from any AsyncController implementation, or CallManager.getCall(String). If the option is not specified in the AsyncController subclass method call, a fail-fast async call will be assumed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Call.State

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getId()
      Get the global unique ID for this asynchronous call.
      Date getResultTime()
      Get the date/time of the result retrieved from the server.
      Call.State getState()
      Get the current state of this asynchronous call.
      String getToken()
      Get the optional token specified by the caller in the options.
      boolean isResultFromCache()
      Check if the result is from the cache.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.Future

        cancel, get, get, isCancelled, isDone

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Get the global unique ID for this asynchronous call. This ID is only useful for the reliable call.
        Returns:
        A unique ID.
        See Also:
        CallManager.getCall(String)

      • getToken

        String getToken()
        Get the optional token specified by the caller in the options.
        Returns:
        A token object, or null.

      • getState

        Call.State getState()
        Get the current state of this asynchronous call.
        Returns:
        The state of the current call.

      • getResultTime

        Date getResultTime()
        Get the date/time of the result retrieved from the server.
        Returns:
        The date/time of the result.

      • isResultFromCache

        boolean isResultFromCache()
        Check if the result is from the cache.
        Returns:
        true if the result is from the cache; otherwise, false.
